intro: Rubus glandulosus var. scaber, commonly known as the rough bramble, is a shrub native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as raspberries, which are typically red when ripe. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
